PRT101.name: Elementary Portuguese I
PRT101.description: Practice in using and understanding Portuguese to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, and cultural topics.

PRT102.name: Elementary Portuguese II
PRT102.description: Further practice in using and understanding Portuguese to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, and cultural topics.

PRT150.name: Intensive Beginning Portuguese
PRT150.description: Development of listening, speaking, reading, writing skills, and cultural knowledge.

PRT201.name: Second-Year Portuguese I
PRT201.description: Intermediate level review and development of aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the Portuguese-speaking world.

PRT202.name: Second-Year Portuguese II
PRT202.description: Further review and development of aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the Portuguese-speaking world.

PRT250.name: Intensive Intermediate Portuguese
PRT250.description: Continued development of listening, speaking, reading, writing skills, and cultural knowledge.

PRT290.name: Independent Study
PRT290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PRT290.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

PRT320.name: Advanced Portuguese
PRT320.description: Conversation, reading, and writing to develop proficiency.

PRT340.name: Topics in Luso-Brazilian Language and Culture
PRT340.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PRT340.description: Cultural issues related to Portuguese-speaking countries.

PRT350.name: Introduction to Literary Analysis (W)
PRT350.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PRT350.description: Reading and analysis of canonical poetry, drama, and prose of the Portuguese-speaking world.

PRT400.name: Reading Portuguese
PRT400.description: Intensive study of Portuguese for students in need of reading knowledge of the language for their disciplines.
PRT400.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students. Approval of department.

PRT490.name: Independent Study
PRT490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
